participating-org.narrative: ROTAB Publiez Ce Que Vous Payez Niger

The network organisation ROTAB (Reseau des Organisations pour la Transparence et ’Analyse Budgétaire - ROTAB Publiez Ce Que Vous Payez Niger) is a development collective consisting of a broad range of associations, NGO's and syndicats within Nigerien civil society that in september 2006 decided to share their experiences and to join forces in a campaign "Publish what you pay for" to promote the transparance with regard to the spending of the revenues of the extractive industries sector in Niger. Not withstanding the last40 years of mining and drilling activities there is no openness whatsoever on the economic gains nor on the investments by the government and the private sector in this vital part of the economy. One thing that is clear is that the profits of this sector have not benefitted the Nigerien population. The ROTAB network decided to concentrate upon the analysis of the national budget to mobilise Nigerien citizins and to stand up against corruption and to insist on transparancy with regardto the income of the Nigerien government from foreign mining and oil companies. To reach its objectives ROTAB employs the following strategies: political lobby and pressure; training and education; denounces and public manifestations, meetings and marches.The network co-ordinates all the activities of the campaign and is also responsible for the capacity building of its member organisations.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
